alert.note: Alert for Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 10:19PM CDT until April 29 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Zapata. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1019 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Zapata, Medina, Falcon Lake Estates, Siesta Shores, Falcon Shores, Zapata County Public Library, Zapata High School, Zapata County Fire Department, Zapata Middle School, Falcon Mesa, Las Palmas, Black Bass, Zapata--Medina and Romeo T. Flores Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
